content.text: Profit growth shows how much net earnings increase after all expenses. It reflects real wealth creation for shareholders.
Formula: Profit Growth % = (Current Profit − Previous Profit) ÷ Previous Profit × 100
Example: Profit increases from ₹100 crore to ₹130 crore → growth = (130 − 100) / 100 = 30%.
Profit growth without sales growth usually means cost cutting, which cannot continue forever.
